content.question: Which correctly notates the repeated rhythmic pattern?

choices.label: One measure of rhythms in six-eight time. Eighth, quarter, eighth, dotted eighth, sixteenth.
One measure of rhythms in six-eight time. Quarter, eighth, dotted eighth, sixteenth, eighth.
One measure of rhythms in six-eight time. Dotted eighth, sixteenth, eighth, eighth, eighth, eighth.
One measure of rhythms in six-eight time. Eighth, dotted eighth, sixteenth, eighth, eighth, eighth.

content.answer: One measure of rhythms in six-eight time. Dotted eighth, sixteenth, eighth, eighth, eighth, eighth.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
